gov.anl.ipns.Util.Numeric
Class Format

java.lang.Object
  gov.anl.ipns.Util.Numeric.Format

public class Format
extends java.lang.Object

Provide convenient text formatting for numeric values that includes string length control.

Method Detail

doubleEng

public static java.lang.String doubleEng(double num,
                                         int field_width)
Format a real number into a string using engineering notation, with thirteen digits after the decimal, appropriate for double precision values.

Parameters:
num - The number to format
field_width - The total number of spaces to be used for the number. If the formatted number does not occupy all of the spaces, leading blanks will be prepended. If more spaces are needed, they will be used.
Returns:
A string containing the formatted number with at least the specified number of characters.

                                            java.lang.String form,
                                            int sig_digits)
Format a real number into a string.

Parameters:
num - The number to format
form - The specified format for displaying num
sig_digits - Significant digits to round and display number.
Returns:
A string containing the formatted number with at least the specified number of characters.

Parameters:
num - The number to format

Returns:
A string containing the formatted number with at least the specified number of characters.

choiceFormat

public static java.lang.String choiceFormat(double num)
Format a real number into a string. Calls the choiceFormat( double, String, int ) with form = AUTO and sig_digits = 4.

Parameters:
num - The number to format
Returns:
A string containing the formatted number with at least the specified number of characters.

round

public static double round(double num,
                           int sig_dig)
Round a real number to the significant digits. This round() method will preserve decimal values. NOTE: Because a double is returned, if the number is rounded to an integer, the number will still contain a decimal and zero. EX. round(100.5,3) = 100.0

Parameters:
num - The number to format
sig_dig - The significant digits to round the number
Returns:
A double rounded to the specified length.

setE

public static java.lang.String setE(double num,
                                    int at_exp,
                                    int sig_dig)
Format a real number into a string number with a specified exponent. NOTE: If num cannot be expressed by at_exp with the significant digits specified (sig_dig), an additional exponent will be added to the returned string. When using this method, use lastIndexOf("E") instead of indexOf("E") from the String class to find the at_exp exponent. If another exponent exists, this was the exponent required to fit num into the significant digits specified. Example: .000012345 written as a power of E3 with 4 significant digits would be represented: 1.235E-8E3 where 1.235E-8 is num and E3 is the power it is to be expressed as.

Parameters:
num - The number to format
at_exp - The exponent the number will be converted to.
sig_dig - Significant digits to round the number.
Returns:
A string containing the formatted number with at least the specified number of characters.

real

public static java.lang.String real(double num,
                                    int field_width,
                                    int num_digits,
                                    boolean use_grouping)
Format a real number into a string.

Parameters:
num - The number to format
field_width - The total number of spaces to be used for the number. If the formatted number does not occupy all of the spaces, leading blanks will be prepended. If more spaces are needed, they will be used.
num_digits - The number of digits to use after the decimal point.
use_grouping - Flag indicating whether or not a grouping symbol is used between groups of three digits.
Returns:
A string containing the formatted number with at least the specified number of characters.

public static java.lang.String real(double num,
                                    int field_width,
                                    int num_digits)

Parameters:
num - The number to format
field_width - The total number of spaces to be used for the number. If the formatted number does not occupy all of the spaces, leading blanks will be prepended. If more spaces are needed, they will be used.
num_digits - The number of digits to use after the decimal point.
Returns:
A string containing the formatted number with at least the specified number of characters.

public static java.lang.String string(java.lang.StringBuffer val,
                                      int field_width,
                                      boolean pad_left)
Pad a StringBuffer on the appropriate side.

Parameters:
val - The StringBuffer to format.
field_width - The total number of spaces to be used for the StringBuffer. If the formatted StringBuffer is larger than the number of spaces provided then the will be used.
pad_left - Whether to pad with spaces on the left or right.
Returns:
A string containing at least the specified number of characters.
